review_title: Great learning experience, got to build portfolio
job_title: Student Worker in South Orange, NJ
pros: Working in the University Relations Office at SHU was such a great experience. I was so fortunate to receive the support and guidance I did in my role. I was trusted to take on exciting projects and really grew. My bosses were mentors and stood up for me. The office understand that being a student comes first and is very flexible to help make sure you are still doing well in your coursework. I got to largely build my own schedule when working remote; once we came back and I was helping in the office, I had more structured hours which was also nice.
cons: Team now works partially remote and partially in-person, so just expect that.

review_title: Like a circus, just less funny.
job_title: Public Safety in South Orange, NJ
pros: Some networking capabilities, and friendly coworkers
cons:
•No clear sense of direction
•too many individuals “in charge”
•claims to have “Chain of Command,” but ‘security managers’ (lowest chain on command post has minimal to no authority)
• some ‘Security Managers,’ as well as dispatchers are very condescending, and talk and treat employees as if they are worthless
•forced overtime, sometimes to the point of exhaustion
•several times upper management has made comments that were indicative to retaliation
•no room for growth 
•promotions are based on how much management likes you
•guards are forced into working roles they did not get hired for, and are not compensated fairly. Ie. Saferide (which pays $4 more than regular guard pay).
•non-existent work-life balance
•expect to get calls on days off to report for duty

review_title: Beautiful campus, decent pay, great benefits
job_title: Anonymous Employee in South Orange, NJ
pros:
When you work at SH, you are literally walking about your customers ... the students, faculty and staff.  There is nothing like witnessing a wedding taking place at the chapel from a park bench, or catching a baseball game when walking from your office back to your car.
Great benefits, lots of time off --
cons: Like anywhere else, the university has it's set of politics.  Also, my start pay was lower than I could have gotten at a corporation.

review_title: Nice job and a fun place to work
job_title: Student Technology Assistant (STA) in South Orange, NJ
pros:
1. You have liberties creating your schedule
2. You have liberties with taking breaks on shifts long enough to allow for breaks
3. You gain technical knowledge on computers, if your a student this is knowledge about your computer
4. Job is very school oriented, they may not schedule you to work during the time of your classes
5. On a slow day (such as a Friday) you are allowed to do homework and other things if there are no clients who need service
cons:
1. You are limited to 20 hours a week during the semester
2. As technology keeps on updating you may be need to learn certain things while you are working with clients
3. Clients can get frustrated at you when they are charged for repairs up to $125

review_title: Good place to work but, I feel bad for the students.....
job_title: Desk Assistant in South Orange, NJ
pros: Was at the parking department at SHU. Amazing place. Very easy going and low accountability.
cons:
hmmm..my conscience was not at peace. I saw how students were not treated fairly and were subjected to silly & rigid rules. I felt really bad for them and finallly couldn't take it anymore. 
Often times they would be fined for silly things and for a student each dollar is a lot of money. It seemed to me that university was more concerned with extracting money from students.

job_title: Administrative Graduate Assistant in South Orange, NJ
pros: Seton Hall is a great place to be a graduate assistant, especially if you work for a department that acknowledges your role as a student. You can feel this out during the interview. Managing my work and studies is very possible, even with two part-time jobs. It's also given me the chance to make friends and professional connections I don't think I would have been able to do otherwise if I weren't involved on campus.
cons: Some departments give GAs (graduate assistants) a huge workload making it difficult to manage school work. Some departments also don't cover full credits each semester. But those aren't issues unique to Seton Hall, every college is different.

job_title: Admissions Intern in Memphis, TN
pros: When I worked here, I was part of an amazing team and had an amazing supervisor. I loved the work I did, and still seek my supervisor's advice as a mentor. I'm a Seton Hall graduate and am incredibly proud to have learned and worked at this institution.
cons: I had an amazing experience working here. As a student of the institution, the Financial Aid office was a nightmare, but that's unrelated.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in South Orange, NJ
pros:
Tuition Remission 
Relaxed and flexible at times, depending on what department you work for. 
 Good people to work with. 
They have Union positions.
If you are a Upper management, you receive a little more the Union employees, however your raises do not come very often.
cons:
Salaries ranging from 18,000 to 35,000 approx in an area where rent is 1600.00 for a 1 bedroom.
Employees have to pay to park on campus.
No room for advancement.
They will spend money on the cosmetics of the University, and not on the employees.

review_title: Review of the work as a work study student for Walsh Library
job_title: Desk Assistant in South Orange, NJ
pros: Easy Job! Especially in the summer. Clocked in 40 hours on my own schedule and most administrators and supervisors take vacation so there was barely any work for me to do. Mostly worked as a desk assistant answering questions, phone calls, some computer skills needed to work printers.
cons: No room for promotions, such as work as graduate assistant which other work studies can lead into. Limited amount of money from work study available. Once depleted the max amount, I had to stop working.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in South Orange, NJ
pros: Great faculty within department. Students are good with respect to communicating and getting back to professors. Most of the students complete their work on time and are receptive to constructive criticism.
cons: Adjunct pay could be a little better. Need to be higher standards for students, a problem that goes very far back. Academic standards also need raising to restore luster to university.

job_title: Stillman School of Business Work Study in South Orange, NJ
pros:
* Ability to network with the Stillman School deans
* Flexibility to make your own schedule (around classes and other commitments)
cons: * The position is not truly a "work-study" position.  When you are in the office, you are expected to be doing work (filing, helping students, etc.), not doing classwork.

job_title: Psychologist in South Orange, NJ
pros: My director and coworkers are phenomenal. I am treated with respect and my opinion is valued. Because it is a smaller school, I can feel my work impacting and can get feedback directly from the deans.
cons: The pay is not competitive. If I was adequately compensated I could see myself staying at Seton Hall for the rest of my career. But that's just not realistic with what they pay.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Monroe Township, NJ
pros:
-great benefits including health/dental/vision coverage, generous sick and vacation leave, access to the gym, employee wellness programs, TIAA-CREF, free tuition for yourself, spouse, and children.
-in general a really nice atmosphere with a lot of nice people - a culture of family
cons:
-parking pass is ridiculously expensive, parking spaces are cramped and it is difficult to find parking if you arrive anytime past 9:00am. 
-The pay is certainly not competative compared to market standards, but I tend to believe that the benefits and culture outweigh this

review_title: Great training ground for Student Affairs Pros
job_title: Administrator in South Orange, NJ
pros:
Friendly environment, that is just the right size to make you feel like you know the people you work with
Tuition remission policy is solid- take advantage! 
Human resources has increased the services they provide
Professional development is supported
cons:
Salaries tend to be on the low side, compared to some other institutions in the area
Employees have to pay for parking

review_title: My experience at Seton Hall University is a learning experience
job_title: in South Orange, NJ
pros:
The university offers excellent Tuition remission opportunities for the staff.
The university as a whole is a relaxed and friendly environment.
cons:
Raises aren't guaranteed.
Depending on the department and management, you will not be able to take classes during the day.

job_title: Calling Crew Student Worker in South Orange, NJ
pros: Flexible schedule. Decent compensation for the work that you do. Opportunities to work extra hours depending on the department you work for. One of the best jobs I've had just because of the additional opportunities I was offered in the admissions department.
cons: Pay could have been a little better. No benefits for student-work obviously. Wish on campus jobs were promoted better. Didn't find out about this job until my junior year of undergrad.

job_title: Graduate Student in South Orange, NJ
pros: Working at Seton Hall University as Graduate Assistant is easy, as management expectations are never high. In addition, work-life balance is great because you can pretty much work when it is more convenient for your schedule
cons: Seton Hall University is a good university to get a master's degree. Graduate students, however, do not get paid enough. With my stipend, I can only cover 50% of my cost of living, but I am expected to work/study full time.

job_title: Enrollment Services in South Orange, NJ
pros: friendly environment, great work life balance, laid-back summers, college atmosphere, tuition remission. The college right now has a lot of good things going for it. A new medical school is underway, student quality is up and the campus has undergone alot of beautiful renovations. Right now it's a great place to be.
cons: there are a lot of politics here. Everyone knows everyone. When there's a position posted, the department usually knows who they'll hire already.

job_title: in South Orange, NJ
pros: The environment is ok and the new facilities make work enjoyable. The stipend is not bad and helps to pay for minimal expenses
cons: The culture is most departments sucks.  Most administrators do not observe the bottom and therefore aimlessly create greater trouble in their departments.

job_title: Research Assistant in South Orange, NJ
pros:
I have been working at Marketing Analytics full-time
Pros
If you like Javascript; it is used heavily in house.
cons:
Cons
There is no growth for developers.
The technologies they use are old.
The management has no mentoring skills.

job_title: Assistant Director IT in South Orange, NJ
pros: The campus is very well kept.  Beautiful manicured lawns.  Lots of vacation time.
cons: There is very little executive leadership.  Middle management has difficulty organizing and accomplishing tasks.   Meetings with vendors are a joke where nothing gets accomplished as politics between two separate it factions waylays most progress.

job_title: Admissions in South Orange, NJ
pros: Seton Hall provided a very easy going workplace environment which allows you to excel in whatever position you hold.  As a continually growing University, new employment and position advancement are always available.
cons: As a growing University, construction will be taking a primary role on campus thus making the workplace a bit noisy at times.

job_title: Student Technology Assistant (STA) in South Orange, NJ
